item.title: Uv is the best thing to happen to the Python ecosystem in a decade
item.description:
venv/bin/activate python myscript. Adding dependencies You can always just edit your pyproject. ) This command automatically edits your pyproject.

item.title: Dithering – Part 1
item.description:
Pixels darker than medium gray turn black and lighter ones turn white. This splits pixels into black or white groups. Some light gray pixels that are closer to white turn black.

Read more

item.title: Extropic is building thermodynamic computing hardware
item.description:
ComputingExtropic is building thermodynamic computing hardware that is radically more energy efficient than GPUs. AnnouncementThermodynamic Computing: From Zero to OneProbabilistic software, meet probabilistic hardware. Inside XTR-0SoftwareINTRODUCING THRMLOur open-source Python library that enables everyone to develop thermodynamic algorithms and simulate running them on TSUsCreate an AlgorithmWhy Probabilistic ComputingWhy Probabilistic ComputingWhy Probabilistic ComputingWhy Probabilistic ComputingWhy Probabilistic ComputingWhy Probabilistic ComputingContinueMediaThermodynamic Computing: From 0 to 1 (Launch Video)October 30th, 2025Extropic Aims to Disrupt the Data Center BonanzaOctober 29th, 2025Core Memory PodMay 16th, 2025Decentralized AI Day 2025March 26th, 2025Wired MagazineMarch 26th, 2025TED AI San FranciscoMarch 18th, 2025Reason Magazine PodDecember 12th, 2024SF Deep Tech WeekAugust 24th, 2024Lightspeed PodJuly 11th, 2024S3 / StoryCoApril 27th, 2024Garry TanMarch 11th, 2024Lex Fridman PodDecember 29th, 2023WritingThermodynamic Computing: From Zero to OneOctober 29th, 2025Inside X0 and XTR-0October 29th, 2025TSU 101: An Entirely New Type of Computing HardwareOctober 29th, 2025We are hiring engineers and scientists to help us pioneer a new form of computing.

item.title: SwirlDB: Modular-first, CRDT-based embedded database
item.description:
Runtime swappable with zero recompilation. Same CRDT engine, same storage interface, just different adapter implementations. Just different backends.

Read more

item.title: The Internet Runs on Free and Open Source Software–and So Does the DNS
item.description:
SAC132 provides timely, nontechnical guidance to ensure that new policy and regulation serve to strengthen, rather than inadvertently weaken, this critical infrastructure. Key Insights for Policymakers SAC132 is a foundational guide designed to empower policymakers to strategically manage and sustain the FOSS ecosystem. We invite all policymakers, technical experts, and stakeholders to read the full report.

Read more

item.title: Detour: Dynamic linking on Linux without Libc
item.description:
At its core, Detour is a minimal bootstrap layer that gives your application access to the system dynamic linker ld-linux. Detour works in both static and dynamic contexts. It works like this: We provide a tiny stub ELF executable that is dynamically linked against the system dynamic linker.

Read more
